alert.note: Alert for Jackson (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued April 19 at 10:57AM CDT until further notice by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1130 AM CDT FOR NORTHWESTERN JO DAVIESS...NORTHWESTERN JACKSON...SOUTHEASTERN DUBUQUE AND NORTHEASTERN JONES COUNTIES... At 1057 AM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Bernard, or 13 miles southwest of Dubuque, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Ping pong ball size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. This severe storm will be near... Zwingle around 1100 AM CDT. La Motte, Dubuque Regional Airport and Swiss Valley Park around 1105 AM CDT. Key West, Mines of Spain, Rockdale and Center Grove around 1110 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of this severe thunderstorm include East Dubuque, St. Donatus, Massey and Menominee. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.50 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...<50 MPH
